TopicTitle: How to feed my own aerodynamic data base?

Articles.Content:
When utilizing FAR, the aerodynamic coefficients of the model ( drag and lift coefficient and so on ) is computed by FAR automatically.  Now I have some drag coefficient data computed by CFD software, and I wonder if it's possible to use these data instead of those provided by FAR, and how can I apply them? 

Thanks advanced if anyone can give a clue.

Hello, and welcome to the forums! 

11 hours ago, mhcha said:

When utilizing FAR, the aerodynamic coefficients of the model ( drag and lift coefficient and so on ) is computed by FAR automatically.  Now I have some drag coefficient data computed by CFD software, and I wonder if it's possible to use these data instead of those provided by FAR, and how can I apply them? 

Thanks advanced if anyone can give a clue. 

Moving to Add-on Discussions, since this is a question about a particular mod.

However, it's worth noting that if you have a question about a specific mod, usually the best place to ask is in the mod's own release thread, since that's where the expert users (and author!) of that mod generally hang out, and therefore is the most likely place to get answers.
